titleStmt.title: The card of courtship or the language of love; fitted to the humours of all degrees, sexes, and conditions. Made up of all sorts of curious and ingenious dialogues, pithy and pleasant discourses, eloquent and winning letters, delicious songs and sonnets, fine fancies, harmonious odes, sweet rhapsodies.
titleStmt.author: Musophilus.

publicationStmt.publisher: Printed by J.C. for Humphrey Mosley; and are to be sold at his shop, at the signe of the Prince's Arms in S. Paul's Church-yard,

notesStmt.note: A miscellany of poems, dialogues, and letters, partly compiled and partly original. Cf. BM catalogue.
Annotations on Thomason copy: "Jan 14 1652"; the '53' in the imprint has been crossed out.
Reproduction of the original in the British Library.

place.placeName: his shop, at the signe of the Prince's Arms in S. Paul's Church-yard
